TEXT: The applicant , Y , born in DATE and resident in GPE , is a NORP citizen of NORP origin . He is represented before the Court by PERSON Ekman , resident in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant and as they appear from the documents , may be summarised as follows .
The applicant claims that he has been persecuted in his country of origin as follows :

The applicant is a well - known writer and a poet in his home town Malikija , GPE . He has been subjected to persecution on grounds of his political opinion and ethnic background . He is a member of ORG in GPE , GPE , which aims at guaranteeing human rights to the NORP people and at having their land returned to them . The applicant has produced anti - government material , such as posters and poems .
In DATE he was questioned by ORG for the first time , having recited his poems at a party . He was issued with a warning .

On DATE he was arrested as a suspect for anti - governmental activities . The arrest lasted DATE during which the applicant was tortured ; he was blindfolded , forced to sit in a car wheel and beaten with a weapon . He was set free in the absence of evidence on the alleged activities , but his friend is still detained .

In DATE he was arrested again , having attended a secret conference arranged by ORG . The arrest lasted DATE during which time he was denied sleep and got only a minimum amount of food . The above mentioned torture was repeated . The applicant ’s brother was arrested at the same time . The applicant was told that his brother became ill while in detention and died , but he suspects that the brother , who was a district leader of the party , was killed . Since DATE the applicant has been questioned many times and ORG has threatened that he will be killed or imprisoned , if he does not change his views and inform on his friends . The applicant claims that there is a warrant for his arrest in GPE and he fears that he will face at least five years’ imprisonment , if he returns to GPE . He argues that also the mere fact that he has sought asylum abroad will get him arrested .

The applicant left GPE in DATE and lived in GPE in DATE . While pursuing studies in the NORP language in DATE , he was politically active providing PERSON with his texts on the conditions in GPE . He is convinced that ORG is aware of his activities in GPE .
The applicant returned to GPE in DATE and faced similar problems as described above . DATE he returned to GPE .

The applicant was able to enter GPE in DATE and leave GPE again in DATE since he paid the airport police MONEY ( ORG ) . He travelled via GPE to GPE and arrived in GPE on DATE . He applied for asylum DATE . He did not present any travel documents and he had only a copy of his NORP passport on him . The applicant claims that he bought a false NORP passport in GPE for CARDINAL . He claims that he gave his NORP passport to a fellow passenger on the bus to GPE , a NORP woman , who promised to send the passport to his girlfriend in GPE . The applicant kept only a copy of the passport . He promised to bring the original passport to the NORP authorities as soon as his girlfriend returned it to him .

The applicant ’s application for asylum and a resident permit was refused by ORG ( ulkomaalaisvirasto , utlänningsverket ) on DATE and an order was issued for his removal to GPE . ORG found , inter alia , that the applicant ’s identity had not been established , that he had not presented any travel documents and that he had not submitted any medical certificates concerning the alleged assaults . During the questioning on arrival in GPE , the applicant did not allege that he was forced to flee to GPE in DATE . The applicant had not given account for his reasons for returning to GPE in DATE , although he claimed that there was a warrant for his arrest . ORG found that it is not credible that a persecuted person , who had been issued an arrest warrant , would be allowed to leave the country . According to the applicant , he had not been arrested since DATE . Moreover , it was not credible that the NORP authorities would take such an interest in someone who read his poems on the radio in GPE that there would be a warrant for his arrest . The mere fact that the applicant belonged to the NORP minority did not constitute a ground for granting him asylum .

On DATE ORG ( hallinto - oikeus , förvaltningsdomstolen ) , having held an oral hearing , rejected the applicant ’s appeal , finding that the story about his reasons for leaving GPE in DATE was vague and superficial . It noted that he was able to visit GPE in DATE and in DATE and that he managed to leave the country in DATE using his own passport . His activities in GPE and GPE , i.e. writing poems and texts about the NORP people ’s situation , can not be considered to be such that he would be in need of international protection . ORG found no evidence that the applicant would be considered an anti - government activist by the NORP authorities . There were CARDINAL NORP in GPE and the mere fact that the applicant was a NORP did not mean that he was in need of international protection . The court concluded that the applicant would not , on his return to GPE , face any individual risk of inhuman treatment .
A request for application of Rule DATE was refused by ORG on DATE .

According to written medical statements submitted by the applicant to ORG , the arches of his feet are low , his ankle joints are “ loose ” , his big toes are in a faulty position and his left calf does not strain normally . Moreover , his feet do not “ roll ” normally when walking . The physiotherapist considered that there was no contradiction between the applicant ’s symptoms – pain in his feet and legs etc . – and the finding . Moreover , the applicant has undergone a discussion therapy but is still suffering from depression and anxiety .

The applicant has also submitted a certificate issued on DATE in Bad Salzuflen , GPE , by ORG in GPE , GPE , according to which he is a member of the above - mentioned ORG and that his life will be in danger if returned to GPE . The applicant has also submitted letters , apparently written by people who know him , according to which his life will be in danger if he returns to GPE , as he is a NORP and as he has applied for asylum abroad .

On DATE ORG ( korkein hallinto - oikeus , högsta förvaltningsdomstolen ) refused the applicant leave to appeal against ORG decision . It is not known whether a date has been set for the applicant ’s removal to GPE .
